intro: Weinmannia glabra var. caripensis, commonly known as the Caripé Weinmannia, is a shrub or small tree native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves that are often arranged in whorls. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
